alert.note: Alert for Cass; Otoe (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 11 at 5:53PM CDT until June 11 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN OTOE AND CASS COUNTIES... At 553 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Avoca, or 14 miles northwest of Nebraska City, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. This storm has a history of producing quarter sized hail. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Dunbar and Nebraska City. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Iowa...and southeastern and east central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
